thread.title: Lady Gaga's Little Monsters Rally Against Body-Shaming Internet Trolls
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga's Little Monsters Rally Against Body-Shaming Internet Trolls

author: Marquita Harris
title: Lady Gaga's Little Monsters Rally Against Body-Shaming Internet Trolls

organizations.name: little monsters rally against body-shaming internet trolls lady gaga

text:
Lady Gaga's Little Monsters Rally Against Body-Shaming Internet Trolls Refinery29 5 hrs ago Marquita Harris
Trolls...monsters...sometimes, the internet can be a scary place. On Sunday, Lady Gaga took to the Super Bowl LI stage, for an epic 12-minute halftime show.
There was fire . There was music. There were also costumes .
Particularly bodysuits and tummy-bearing crop tops from Versace . Gaga's body â€” in all of its fit, dancer-trained glory â€” was on full display.
And some people were less focused on the pomp and circumstance at hand and more interested in criticizing Gaga's tummy. Â© The Associated Press Singer Lady Gaga performs during the halftime show of the NFL Super Bowl 51 football game between the New England Patriots and the Atlanta Falcons, Sunday, Feb. 5, 2017, in Houston. (AP Photo/Matt Slocum)
"I just feel like #Gaga's dough belly should've been tucked in better. #jussayin," said @jfsartain . Consider this one of the tamest of many harsh tweets. "BLOWN AWAY that I'm seeing tweets about the Super Bowl saying Lady Gaga has a fat belly, like seriously," said user @lindablacker .
BLOWN AWAY that I'm seeing tweets about the Super Bowl saying Lady Gaga has a fat belly, like seriously?!
Mainly women too. ðŸ˜”
â€” Linda Blacker (@lindablacker) February 6, 2017 Luckily, Gaga's fans, her "Little Monsters," and other viewers came to her defense.
Lady Gaga was stunning and put on one hell of a show! To those body shaming her- you are disgusting! #stopbodyshaming #ladygaga #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/85hjnUqbgy
â€” The Lipstick Print (@lipstick_print) February 6, 2017 Someone plz explain to me why everyone is body shaming lady gaga I do not understand
â€” Kirsten Brown (@Brownie13_) February 6, 2017 Love her little belly. #teambelly #SuperBowl #gaga
â€” quinta b. (@quintabrunson) February 6, 2017 Thankfully the onslaught of negative, body-shaming attacks were engulfed by a flood of body-positive messages. Way to come through internet.
